docs.snippet: Key words and subjects offer a glimpse into a candidate's promotional strategy....
docs.lead_paragraph: To drive traffic to their Web sites, corporations pay Google to display an ad for their products with certain keywords and phrases. The presidential candidates for 2008 are doing the same: search for "tort reform," and a link to the Web site of Senator John McCain, a Republican, may turn up, while "universal health care" may draw the campaign site of Representative Dennis J. Kucinich, a Democrat.

headline.main: Tailored Search Terms Offer Links to Campaigns

docs.snippet: Google said on Monday it has agreed to buy Postini, a maker of Web-based security software, for $625 million, expanding its package of online applications to compete with Microsoft's Office suite of programs. Postini provides security and encrypti...
docs.lead_paragraph: Google said on Monday it has agreed to buy Postini, a maker of Web-based security software, for $625 million, expanding its package of online applications to compete with Microsoft's Office suite of programs. Postini provides security and encryption services, protecting instant messaging, e-mail and other communications, to more than 35,000 businesses and 10 million users worldwide.

headline.main: Google to Acquire Postini for $625 Million

docs.snippet: The name may conjure visions of one building, but it's much bigger than that....
docs.lead_paragraph: Something simply named the Red Mosque may conjure visions of one building, but the complex where Pakistani troops have faced off against militant clerics and their followers over the past week is much, much bigger than that. To get a feeling of how vast, take a gander at the Google satellite image above (for scale, the little white rectangles scattered around the image are cars), and read a description that appeared in The New York Times's coverage of the confrontation this morning:

headline.main: Satellite View of The Red Mosque

docs.lead_paragraph: To drive traffic to their Web sites, corporations pay Google to display an advertisement for their products with certain keywords and phrases. The presidential candidates for 2008 are doing the same: search for “tort reform,” and a link to the Web site of Senator John McCain, Republican of Arizona, may turn up, while “universal health care” may draw the campaign site of Representative Dennis J. Kucinich, Democrat of Ohio.

headline.main: Buying Into Web Presence

docs.snippet: PLEA LIKELY TO HELP CASE A seven-year federal investigation into accusations that a leading securities class-action law firm, Milberg Weiss, paid secret kickbacks to plaintiffs has gained traction with a former partner's guilty plea. [C1.]     GOO...
docs.lead_paragraph: PLEA LIKELY TO HELP CASE A seven-year federal investigation into accusations that a leading securities class-action law firm, Milberg Weiss, paid secret kickbacks to plaintiffs has gained traction with a former partner's guilty plea. [C1.] GOOGLE BUYS SECURITY COMPANY Google said it would buy Postini, the e-mail security and management company, for $625 million in cash. The deal indicates Google's desire to become a serious player in the business of selling productivity software to companies and organizations in competition with Microsoft and others. ''In bigger businesses, security and compliance requirements are a must,'' said Dave Girouard, above, Google's vice president and general manager for enterprise. [C1.]

headline.main: TODAY IN BUSINESS

docs.snippet: To drive traffic to their Web sites, corporations pay Google to display an advertisement for their products with certain keywords and phrases. The presidential candidates for 2008 are doing the same: search for ''tort reform,'' and a link to the W...
docs.lead_paragraph: To drive traffic to their Web sites, corporations pay Google to display an advertisement for their products with certain keywords and phrases. The presidential candidates for 2008 are doing the same: search for ''tort reform,'' and a link to the Web site of Senator John McCain, Republican of Arizona, may turn up, while ''universal health care'' may draw the campaign site of Representative Dennis J. Kucinich, Democrat of Ohio. Noah Elkin, vice president for corporate strategy at iCrossing, an Internet marketing firm that studied the campaigns' search-engine visibility in May, said Mr. McCain's strategy was the most effective: focusing on issue-related keywords. ''He was appearing around terms that people were searching '' based on iCrossing's analysis, Mr. Elkin said.

headline.main: Buying Into Web Presence

docs.abstract: Presidential candidates are paying search engines to display ads to drive voters to their Web sites; Republican presidential hopeful John McCain's strategy is seen as most effective, by focusing on issue-related keywords (M)

docs.snippet: COMPANY REPORTS Earnings season gets into full swing, particularly for technology, financial and drug companies. Reports will come from Charles Schwab and Mattel (Monday); Coca-Cola, I.B.M., Intel, Johnson & Johnson, Merrill Lynch, Novartis, W...
docs.lead_paragraph: COMPANY REPORTS Earnings season gets into full swing, particularly for technology, financial and drug companies. Reports will come from Charles Schwab and Mattel (Monday); Coca-Cola, I.B.M., Intel, Johnson & Johnson, Merrill Lynch, Novartis, Wells Fargo and Yahoo (Tuesday); Abbott Laboratories, Altria, AMR, Delta Air Lines, eBay, JPMorgan Chase, Pfizer, Southwest Airlines and United Technologies (Wednesday); Advanced Micro Devices, Bank of America, Bank of New York Mellon, Continental Airlines, Dow Jones, First Data, Google, Honeywell, Microsoft, Motorola and Wyeth (Thursday); and Boston Scientific, Caterpillar and Citigroup (Friday).

headline.main: Looking Ahead

docs.lead_paragraph: COMPANY REPORTS Earnings season gets into full swing, particularly for technology, financial and drug companies. Reports will come from Charles Schwab and Mattel (Monday); Coca-Cola, I.B.M., Intel, Johnson & Johnson, Merrill Lynch, Novartis, Wells Fargo and Yahoo (Tuesday); Abbott Laboratories, Altria, AMR, Delta Air Lines, eBay, JPMorgan Chase, Pfizer, Southwest Airlines and United Technologies (Wednesday); Advanced Micro Devices, Bank of America, Bank of New York Mellon, Continental Airlines, Dow Jones, First Data, Google, Honeywell, Microsoft, Motorola and Wyeth (Thursday); and Boston Scientific, Caterpillar and Citigroup (Friday). ECONOMIC SIGNALS The inflation picture will be clarified with the producer price index for June (Tuesday) and the consumer price index for June (Wednesday). The Federal Reserve will release minutes from its June 28 meeting (Thursday).

docs.lead_paragraph: REDSTONE FAMILY DRAMA A rift between the media billionaire Sumner M. Redstone and his daughter Shari, whom he had previously portrayed as his successor, has called into question who will eventually inherit ultimate control of the CBS and Viacom empires. A SELL-OFF ON GOOGLE SHARES Google reported another quarter of rapid revenue growth on the strength of its core Internet search and advertising business, but expenses grew faster than investors anticipated, profits fell short of analysts' expectations and shares dropped 7 percent in after-hours trading. docs.snippet: The Dow Jones industrial average closed above 14,000 for the first time on Thursday, only to fall back on Friday. Friday's losses pulled the major market averages into negative territory for the week.     On Friday, the Dow dropped by nearly 150 p...
docs.lead_paragraph: The Dow Jones industrial average closed above 14,000 for the first time on Thursday, only to fall back on Friday. Friday's losses pulled the major market averages into negative territory for the week. On Friday, the Dow dropped by nearly 150 points, afterGoogle and Caterpillar announced earnings for the second quarter that failed to meet Wall Street's expectations.

docs.snippet: The junta starts to deal with its democracy problems....
docs.lead_paragraph: A computer programmer/blogger brings word via Boing Boing that Thailand has unblocked YouTube again, more than three months after several videos posted on the site were deemed insulting to the king, a high crime in that country. Google, the owner of YouTube, agreed to block access to those three videos itself, but not to others cited by the Thai government.

headline.main: YouTube Unblocked as Thai Junta Relaxes

docs.snippet: Even after 25 years of learning the basics, most adults are still playing catch-up when it comes to conversing in emoticon-ese. Luckily, a seemingly limitless supply of emoticon dictionaries have accumulated on the Internet (several of which suppl...
docs.lead_paragraph: Even after 25 years of learning the basics, most adults are still playing catch-up when it comes to conversing in emoticon-ese. Luckily, a seemingly limitless supply of emoticon dictionaries have accumulated on the Internet (several of which supplied the following examples), meaning fluency in this graphical lexicon is only a Google search away. As with any language, one should start slowly and master the handful of basic emoticons before moving on to more sophisticated -- and cryptic -- symbols. And remember, should one stumble, that it's not considered cheating to tilt the computer monitor sideways. ALEX WILLIAMS

headline.main: How to Say It With Emoticon
